author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Hello, I am an automated registration bot. I help manage the registration process by checking your registration against a set of [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). If all these guidelines are met, this pull request will be merged automatically, completing your registration. It is **strongly recommended** to follow the guidelines, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

## 1. New package registration

Please make sure that you have read the [package naming guidelines](https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1).

## 2. [AutoMerge Guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/) which are not met ‚ùå

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an upper-case letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, not all letters are upper-case.
- Name is not at least 5 characters long
- The following dependencies do not have a `[compat]` entry that is upper-bounded and only includes a finite number of breaking releases: BenchmarkTools, Distributions, ForwardDiff, HDF5, Integrals, Interpolations, LaTeXStrings, Plots, Polynomials, ProgressMeter, QuadGK, Roots, Trapz
    <details><summary>Extended explanation</summary>

    Your package has a Project.toml file which might look something like the following:

    ```toml
    name = "YourPackage"
    uuid = "random id"
    authors = ["Author Names"]
    version = "major.minor"

    [deps]
    # Package dependencies
    # ...

    [compat]
    # ...
    ```

    Every package listed in `[deps]`, along with `julia` itself, must also be listed under `[compat]` (if you don't have a `[compat]` section, make one!). See the [Pkg docs](https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/compatibility/) for the syntax for compatibility bounds, and [this documentation](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/#Upper-bounded-%5Bcompat%5D-entries) for more on the kinds of compat bounds required for AutoMerge.

    </details>

- Package name similar to 17 existing packages.
  <details>
  <summary>Similar package names</summary>

  1. Similar to GR. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 is at or below cutoff of 2. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 1 between lowercased names is at or below cutoff of 1. Normalized visual distance 1.26 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
  2. Similar to GMT. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  3. Similar to H3. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  4. Similar to Z3. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  5. Similar to GSL. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  6. Similar to GAP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  7. Similar to PWF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  8. Similar to AWS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  9. Similar to Gen. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  10. Similar to Tk. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  11. Similar to GCP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  12. Similar to Git. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  13. Similar to Gtk. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  14. Similar to Gym. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  15. Similar to GLM. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  16. Similar to Glo. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
  17. Similar to GLFW. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.

  </details>


## 3. *Needs action*: here's what to do next

1. Please try to update your package to conform to these guidelines. The [General registry's README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) has an FAQ that can help figure out how to do so.
2. After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simply retrigger Registrator, the same way you did in the initial registration. This will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number).

If you need help fixing the AutoMerge issues, or want your pull request to be manually merged instead, please post a comment explaining what you need help with or why you would like this pull request to be manually merged. Then, send a message to the `#pkg-registration` channel in the [public Julia Slack](https://julialang.org/slack/) for better visibility.

## 4. To pause or stop registration

If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.

_Tip: You can edit blocking comments to add `[noblock]` in order to unblock auto-merging._

<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

body:
- Registering package: GW
- Repository: https://github.com/andrea-begnoni/GW.jl
- Created by: @andrea-begnoni
- Version: v0.1.0
- Commit: c40103f3de194ac2f878768a966d5ee5205f11bc
- Reviewed by: @andrea-begnoni
- Reference: https://github.com/andrea-begnoni/GW.jl/commit/c40103f3de194ac2f878768a966d5ee5205f11bc#commitcomment-164907713
- Release notes:
<!-- BEGIN RELEASE NOTES -->
`````
# GW.jl

### Perform accurate and fast parameter estimation of Gravitational Waves sources using the Fisher Information Matrix (alias GWJulia).

Main features:

- Generate a catalog of compact binary sources
- Perform a Fisher Matrix analysis with automatic differentiation
- Analyze the results and obtain the errors in the parameters of the binary
- Very fast, it takes less than a second to compute the Fisher Matrix, independently of the waveform model and the detector(s) configuration

### Citating this work

If you use this code in your work, please cite:

```
@article{Begnoni:2025oyd,
    author = "Begnoni, Andrea and Anselmi, Stefano and Pieroni, Mauro and Renzi, Alessandro and Ricciardone, Angelo",
    title = "{Detectability and Parameter Estimation for Einstein Telescope Configurations with GWJulia}",
    eprint = "2506.21530",
    archivePrefix = "arXiv",
    primaryClass = "astro-ph.CO",
    month = "6",
    year = "2025"
}
```

### Contacts

If you need any help, feel free to contact andrea.begnoni@phd.unipd.it
`````
<!-- END RELEASE NOTES -->

<!--  -->
title: New package: GW v0.1.0
